meanings.definition: To corrupt or seduce someone morally
meanings.sent1: The villain was debauching the young minds with his evil ideas.
meanings.sent2: She warned her friend about the dangers of debauching their values for temporary gains.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous imp delighted in debauching the innocent townsfolk with his pranks.
meanings.sent4: The dark magic of the cursed amulet seemed to debauch the very essence of those who wore it.
meanings.sent5: The sinister cult leader had a way of debauching even the most virtuous individuals.

meanings.definition: To lead someone into a life of excessive indulgence in sensual pleasures
meanings.sent1: The wealthy socialite was debauching her guests with lavish parties and extravagant gifts.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was debauching himself with unhealthy habits and decided to make a change.
meanings.sent3: The tempting aroma of freshly baked cookies was debauching his diet plans.
meanings.sent4: The all-you-can-eat buffet seemed to debauch even the most disciplined eaters.
meanings.sent5: The luxurious spa retreat was debauching her senses with its soothing treatments.
